metadata.title: CVE-2017-8028 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Pivotal Spring-LDAP versions 1.3.0 - 2.3.1, when connected to some LDAPservers, when no additional attributes are bound, and when using LDAPBindAuthenticator withorg.springframework.ldap.core.support.DefaultTlsDirContextAuthenticationStrategyas the authentication strategy, and setting userSearch, authentication isallowed with an arbitrary password when the username is correct. Thisoccurs because some LDAP vendors require an explicit operation for the LDAPbind to take effect.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8028` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-ldap-java - 1.3.1.RELEASE-4+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-ldap-java package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.1.RELEASE-4+deb7u1build0.14.04.1').
